constructors.doc: Returns a new cell renderer which will show a spinner to indicate activity.
constructors.name: new

doc:
GtkCellRendererSpinner renders a spinning animation in a cell, very similar to . It can often be used as an alternative to a for displaying indefinite activity, instead of actual progress.

To start the animation in a cell, set the property to 

true
and increment the property at regular intervals. The usual way to set the cell renderer properties for each cell is to bind them to columns in your tree model using e.g. .
name: CellRendererSpinner

properties.doc:
Pulse of the spinner. Increment this value to draw the next frame of the spinner animation. Usually, you would update this value in a timeout.

By default, the widget draws one full cycle of the animation, consisting of 12 frames, in 750 milliseconds.
properties.name: pulse

properties.doc: The value that specifies the size of the rendered spinner.
properties.name: size
